meanings.definition: Superficially plausible, but actually wrong or misleading.
meanings.sent1: The specious argument seemed convincing at first, but it was full of errors.
meanings.sent2: Her specious smile hid her true feelings of sadness.
meanings.sent3: The specious excuse of the dog eating the homework didn't fool anyone.
meanings.sent4: The specious promise of easy money led to disappointment.
meanings.sent5: The specious advertisement made the product seem better than it was.

meanings.sent1: The specious jewelry caught her eye, but it turned out to be fake.
meanings.sent2: The specious painting looked beautiful from afar, but up close, it was poorly done.
meanings.sent3: The specious dessert looked delicious, but it tasted terrible.
meanings.sent4: The specious packaging made the product seem more luxurious than it was.
meanings.sent5: The specious flower arrangement brightened up the room with its fake blooms.

meanings.definition: Having a false look of truth or genuineness.
meanings.sent1: The specious document appeared official, but it was forged.
meanings.sent2: His specious apology seemed sincere, but he was just trying to avoid trouble.
meanings.sent3: The specious alibi fell apart under scrutiny.
meanings.sent4: The specious evidence was quickly debunked by the experts.
meanings.sent5: The specious witness testimony led to an innocent person being accused.
